title: 103_hr3654
content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk "OF INTERCIRCUIT CONFLICTS." The amendment establishes the Intercircuit California En Banc Court for the Ninth and Twelfth Circuits in California to resolve conflicts between their decisions. The Intercircuit California En Banc Court for the Ninth and Twelfth Circuits in California resolves conflicts between decisions that may lead to inconsistent Federal law within the state. Appeals can be reheard by the Intercircuit Court upon request by a judge in regular active service. The Intercircuit California En Banc Court for the Ninth and Twelfth Circuits resolves conflicts between decisions that may lead to inconsistent Federal law within the state. Rehearing by the Intercircuit Court is limited to cases where resolving a conflict would be unusually burdensome to the administration of Federal law in California. The clerks of the Ninth and Twelfth Circuits serve as the clerk of the Intercircuit Court on alternate 2-year periods. SEC. 4. ASSIGNMENT AND SENIORITY OF JUDGES. "46. Assignment of judges; panels; hearing; Intercircuit Court; quorum." Each circuit judge in regular active service of the former ninth circuit is assigned to the new ninth circuit or twelfth circuit based on their official duty station before the effective date of the Act. Senior judges of the former circuit are also reassigned accordingly. Each senior judge of the former ninth circuit can choose to be assigned to the new ninth circuit or the twelfth circuit. Seniority is based on the date of commission as a judge of the former ninth circuit. SEC. 5. PENDING PROCEEDINGS. Any appeal or proceeding filed with the former ninth circuit before the effective date of this Act will either continue as if the Act had not been enacted if already submitted for decision, or be transferred to the appropriate court for further proceedings if not yet submitted. A petition for rehearing or rehearing en banc in a matter decided before the effective date of this Act will be treated as if the Act had not been enacted. If rehearing en banc is granted, the matter will be reheard by a court as if the Act had not been enacted. SEC. 6. Transitional provision states that the new ninth circuit and twelfth circuit will be considered a single circuit for certain purposes. SEC. 7 provides definitions for terms used in sections 4, 5, and 6. SEC. 8 addresses administrative actions. SEC. 8. ADMINISTRATIVE ACTIONS. The court of appeals for the ninth circuit may take necessary administrative action to implement this Act and will cease to exist for administrative purposes on July 1, 1997. SEC. 9. EFFECTIVE DATE. This Act and its amendments will be effective on October 1, 1994.
